724900f-a.text:
1314-1318-13222 York Avenue (Avenue A), at and adjoining N.E. corner of 70th Street. 1314 was built around 1905 on the site of the Davis Moulding Mill (1895). 1318 is old 1318-20 remodelleo. 1322 was built around 1895, as a cigar factory, and used around 1916 by the American Tobacco Company. These buildings are all about to be demolished; and their place will be taken by some of the new New York Hospital and Cornell Medical School buildingai a
laboratory and the Nurses' Home.
February 13, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

714283f-a.text:
70th Street at and east of Tork venue,seen across the clearing from 69th Street east of York wvenue. The photographer is standing near the site of the Lenox Hill Settlement House and Neighborhood Club, 5l1-515 East 69th Street. The south side of 70th Street is marked by the . ooden fence. Cn the north side of 70th Street the
buildings are being demolished.
This block, from 69th to 70th Streets, used to be Washington Park, prior to about 1895, and then was built up,mostly with tenement houses. It will now be part of the site of the New York HosDital and Cri ell Medical College, (see York wenue).
Migust 21,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
